embeds.title: Combo
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Put the first  (2) **Dead On** card (cards) triggered each turn back into your hand.

messages.content: remember when this card used to be a win condition?
Yeah it used to generate a random dead on card whenever you triggered a dead on card.
Not a lot of people used it, but it was found out that it could beat the heart with almost no support so it was subsequently nerfed to the current version, which I like more
so the old version just generated new cards indefinitely like dead branch?
this seems a lot more sensible than that design
It is
Other one was too strong and also rng.

The fact that it's putting dead on cards on the right of your hand means you need to be really all-in on the archetype (in which case you care less about replaying the card and more about shifting your remaining cards left) and/or going for a really big turn to get much value out of this
but it's not unreasonable, especially with [[enervate]]

embeds.title: Enervate
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Deal 7 (10) damage.
**Dead On:**
Gain :energy_hermit:  and draw a card.

messages.content: Yeah this really makes you wish <lone wolf>'s wording was consistent with what it says, but that is a base game problem

embeds.description:

Choose a card.
It costs 0 this turn.
Discard the rest of your hand.

messages.content: still, lone wolf and <roughhouse> is super mega iron wave

embeds.title: Roughhouse
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 3 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Deal 24 (30) damage. **Dead On:**
Gain 20 (24) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: yes I would like 60 damage 48 block.
I didn't even think of lone wolf. I always overlook that card

this used to be comically OP
now it's a way of recurring dead on cards
honestly other than intentionally setting up high cost dead on cards or powers, it just lacks any utility. It's an awkward seeing red with dead on activation built in.
it can be a bit hard to retrigger their dead on effects, but just playing them more than once can be enough
this doesn't exhaust
It used to (also used to make the card 0 for the rest of combat iirc)
yes

I think lone wolf is a little awkward in the fact that it really isn't worth using on anything that isn't a high value dead on or 2+ cost card. Honestly hermit doesn't too many valuable high cost cards.
The hermit has a lot of cards that just don't work with lone wolf. It's highly specialized
and if you're in the curse archetype the last thing you want to be drawing is a do-nothing energy-saving card
worlds most energy hungry card
it putting the card at the edge of your hand means that repeating that effect requires insane amounts of energy or eternal form
I don't take this card anymore unless my entire deck is snapshot and zero costs or I'm playing eternal form every fight
oh yeah this thing goes nuts with eternal form
basically gets you the best case scenario every turn
>play dead on card
>it's now at the edge of your hand
>spend two energy to get it to the middle again
>spend one more energy playing it
>then spend another energy on it
you need eternal form to make this thing work consistently
I would rather use smoking barrel in a typical deck tbh.

This is one of hermits flagship cards; its existence is a big part in how the character plays even in the runs where you never pick it. Combo is the main source of scaling for all dead on cards; it lets you use one of your dead on cards multiple times as long as you can afford to do so. In other words this makes scaling dead on cards like deadeye and dive substantially better to the point where they are acutally viable for scaling at all. It also makes every other dead on card in your deck better too since you have near complete control over which cards you play first; its notably good on enervate since you can play it "for free" 3  times per turn. It also is extremely strong with smoking barrel since it lets you build up damage by playing block dead on cards which you can then use with an attack like headshot or ricochet. Unlike many other hermit powers combo is fast enough to play in hallway fights; making it far easier to pick up. Without combo decks that have a lot of dead on cards have a hard time scaling and are likely to have to switch strategies entirely. When drafting cards early game you have to carefully consider if you want to commit to trying to find combo or pivoting away from dead on and trying to get another source of scaling from cards like determination or shadow cloak. Hermit has to plan multiple acts ahead more so then most other characters do since he relys a lot on powers and combo is a big part as to why that is.
so ya I think combo is kind of strong

combo is pseudo card draw
hermit has +4 energy per turn card
pseudo card draw good

I think you may be placing a little more emphasis than I do in this card for dead on decks. Vantage is a common (meaning it's easy to have 2-3 copies) and does mostly the same thing on any turn you can use it, while also providing minor scaling. If you have many dead on cards it's generally not too hard to activate several per turn without this card's help. And without Eternal Form you won't have the energy to take advantage of this on most turns. It has its place, but it's not essential.

Frankly if you're not going for act 4, I don't think you need this or smoking barrel. Almost all the Dead On cards are strong frontloaded effects with some scaling, so you can just clear hallway fights with no powers and only worry about scaling during the bosses.
and both those powers require you to jump through hoops in order to actually get enough value to not feel weak. Most of the dead on attacks aren't multihit, and this one requires a lot of energy

The main factors to consider are how much energy you have/your ability to proc dead on/how good your dead-on cards are. You will also probably want some card draw/concentrate to support this since the card will be added to the far right of your hand, and playing it without triggering dead-on is mediocre (and if you're not recasting the dead-on card, then why is combo in your deck?) This is a powerful support card that lets you effectively draw more cards each turn, and pairs well with deadeye, dive+, and smoking barrel. Enervate can be very strong with combo, as it’s card and energy neutral. Combo also goes well with eternal form, which gives you extra energy to play the extra cards. You definitely can build heavily around dead on (especially defensive dead-on cards), and this is a solid piece in that puzzle. 

The upgrade lets you loop/pseudo draw even more dead-on cards, but you really want to make sure you have the energy to play those cards before considering upgrading it. You can make it much easier to proc dead on if you discard/play out most of your hand quickly (lots of 0 cost cards), as every card in a 1 or 2 card hand is considered dead on, and that is especially powerful with combo putting those cards right back into your hand. You won’t always be able to support this card effectively, but it’s quite strong when you can.

Notably a cheap power that can be triggered on the same turn you cast it, so you can start getting value immediately, but that would require large amounts of energy, or a mummified hand. Not particularly good until you have the 4th energy, so I often avoid it in act 1.

I always consider act 4 (and a20) when analyzing things. Eye of the storm can also be enough to fuel combo. You don't need that much support for combo other then energy and not having curses; at worst you could say that combo is a bad act 1 pick, which I sort of agree with (you can take combo in act 1 as an investment but its not doing much in that act)
vantage is also a card that benefits a lot from combo since you can use it to upgrade and cycle through your deck
or lone wolf. Or 0 cost deck (luck of the draw spam)
